Key Arguments: The legislation gives too much power to potentially corrupt bodies to decide what is true and what is misinformation.
There is a risk of disregarding scientific, medically peer-reviewed, and government statistical proof.
The legislation could polarize the population and lead to tyranny.
The government has been involved in spreading misinformation during the pandemic, leading to harm and destruction.
Truth should belong to each citizen, and removing the right to speak the truth is a crime against humanity.
Notable Quotes: Truth belongs to each citizen. Noone has the right to take that away.

An horrific crime against humanity is underway globally and removing individuals rights to speak the truth is making the Australian Government continue to be not just an accessory but entirely a systemic, institutional perpetrator of that ongoing crime.
